website_summaries.verdict: The Dell UltraSharp U2713HM is an excellent monitor that will satisfy both the performance snob and the features diva alike.
pros: The Dell UltraSharp U2713HM delivers excellent performance across the board, includes a huge array of customization options, and has great ergonomic support
cons: There's a slight green tint problem when watching movies, and $800 is a lot to pay for a monitor, no matter what's included

website_summaries.verdict: The Dell UltraSharp U2713HM is a 27-inch IPS monitor that's packed with features.

customer_reviews.title: Great Monitor!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely great monitor! The picture is stunning and the color is great. I debated between this and Samsung's new TN panel 4k monitor but honestly this monitor at 1440p is pixel dense and looks much better than 1080p without the software issues of 4k. In addition the Dell includes USB 3.0 ports on the side and 4 different connector options. I highly recommend this monitor and already want a second to replace my 1080 Acer secondary display.
customer_reviews.author: C.R. Capps

customer_reviews.title: Poor Quality Control
customer_reviews.text: Poor QC from Dell. First monitor had backlight bleed. Amazon sent a replacement unit, but this second monitor had backlight bleed as well. Going to try one last time before giving up. If the calibration report that comes with your monitor has massive spikes on certain colors that are > DeltaE of 6, check if you have backlight bleed. On both my monitors, that was the case. UPDATE: I received another replacement. There's still some light bleeds, but it's within an amount that is acceptable, so I'm increasing the rating to 3 stars. The point about poor QC still stands. Shouldn't take 3 tries to get an acceptable monitor.
customer_reviews.author: E.W.

customer_reviews.title: Quality does matter
customer_reviews.text: I've been buying Dell monitors for many years, and this one was as good as it gets. Out of the box it worked perfectly, after small adjustments, just to match it to the other Dell U2412M 1920x1200 monitor in color and brightness. They are now perfectly matched and both are a delight to work with. I do graphics output, videos, movies, and games on the 27 inch and use my software programs (Lightwave 3D, PS, Vue, etc) on the 24 inch monitor (fonts are more easily read at that resolution). A perfect division of labor, if you will.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Monitor for Late 2013 Mac Pro
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this monitor instead of Apple's Thunderbolt display because I don't like the high-gloss and highly reflective screen used by Apple.the Apple monitor is very overpriced whereas the Dell is pricey but reasonable. The Dell monitor has a wonderful, matte finish that looks crystal clear yet minimizes glare and reflections. My unit has no stuck pixels, light bleed, or any other malady I can detect. And it works perfectly at full resolution with the latest Mac OSX. Just purchase a mini displayport to display port cable. Plug the mini displayport side into one of the Mac's thunderbolt ports and you're good to go. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Great value -- Still a Display Port oddity.
customer_reviews.text: This is a very good screen. Like others, I have an occasional problem with my older MacBook Pro and the display port: Every once in a while, the screen will go dark for a second. This occurs seldom enough that it is not a significant problem. The control buttons and menus are good. The screen is sharp and as bright as you want it to be; I run mine at 50% of the brightness scale. The monitor is quite light; the stand effective and easily adjusted. If you have a computer that supports the 2560x1440, it is great.
customer_reviews.author: rjn

customer_reviews.title: No issues with my monitor
customer_reviews.text: I was a little wary of all the negative reviews but i have two other Dell monitors (U2410 and 2007WFP) The color on this monitor is immaculate and I don't have any backlight bleed problems or strange color tints. It did look a little weird at first when Windows 7 was using it's own color profile but once I downloaded the correct one from the Dell website everything looked great. It's not very heavy, and is the same height as my 24 inch U2410, just way wider. The only negative is I now have three monitors that all have different resolutions but this is the result of me upgrading incrementally every few years.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: This monitor is amazing. The resolution is great, the colors are vibrant, and I don't get any streaking or tearing when playing games running at 60 fps at full resolution. The backlight is unobtrusive and I'm able to see dark colors without feeling like it's washed out. I'd recommend a color calibration after purchasing for best results. My only complaint is that it experiences temporary burn-in rather badly when displaying white windows. I work on this monitor all day, and when I switch over to play a game after hours I can see where all of my windows were for about 5 minutes. After other colors have been displayed it fades, but it's still annoying.
customer_reviews.author: J Larsen

customer_reviews.title: Great in-between size, excellent resolution
customer_reviews.text: I considered going to a 30" monitor vs. the 2x24" Ultrasharps I had. The 30" version is quite pricey for a good quality monitor. So I went in-between and got two 27" monitors instead. I can fit quite a bit more on each than I could my 24" at max resolution (can leave the monitors in landscape orientation and still see a full-page in a Word document only taking up less than half of one monitor. That leaves me lots of room for a web browser, email and a spreadsheet all open at the same time at a very usable size. A definate improvement over the 24" setup for about half the cost of a single 30" monitor.
customer_reviews.author: FrequentBuyerWA

customer_reviews.title: Don't bother - Dell QC is not doing their job
customer_reviews.text: Just bought this monitor, twice - the price and feature set were exactly where I wanted to be - IPS panel, 27" and good resolution. Out of the box, my monitor did not work - Colored confetti all over the screen with a barely visible picture just behind. DOA on a monitor should be easy to check for before it gets shipped from the factory. This was my second DOA on this model - The first never powered on at all, and I'm not going to risk a third. It's going back to Amazon, and I'm going to look for brands other than Dell, even if I have to pay a bit more. Completely disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Cebelenski

customer_reviews.title: So much for their warranty...
customer_reviews.text: Their premium panel guarantee apparently does not cover dead pixels in the center of the screen. What's the point of paying for a premium monitor if they don't cover dead pixels? Talked to Dell support, sent pictures, and was informed that they don't cover dead pixels. Won't be buying a premium Dell panel again.
customer_reviews.author: J. Jones

customer_reviews.title: Excellent monitor for office work and gaming
customer_reviews.text: This monitor is great for general office work and gaming. I use this monitor as my sole home office monitor as I work from home, it's nice crisp and easy on the eyes. The monitor can be in use for an excess of 8 hours and it remains cool. I previously had the Asus PB278Q and that monitor wasn't as sharp IMO using the same devices. Gaming on this monitor is also great, I use it to game on a PS4, crisp image and great saturation when using "game mode". No noticeable lag or ghosting. I highly recommend for an all in one monitor for your home office/gaming system.
customer_reviews.author: jrvtecaccord

customer_reviews.title: Be Aware of Cable Need!
customer_reviews.text: Everyone should be aware that to achieve the full 2560x1440 you need to have a better quality DVI cable that has all the pins. If you look at the end of your cable and you see two groups of I believe 9 pins each it won't work. You should see a single solid block of pins extending all the way from the blade pin to the other side of the connector. Otherwise you will be limited to 1920 pixels. Theoretically HDMI should work as well. But you need a card that supports resolutions beyond HD over HDMI. None I saw state that and the couple I tried did not.
customer_reviews.author: W. E. Vanderslice

customer_reviews.title: 3 dead pixels right next to each other.
customer_reviews.text: Other than the dead pixels, the monitor does look great. There is some backlight bleed, especially in the bottom left corner - but nothing that's significant... it kinda looks a little yellow, but it seemed to match exactly what I've seen in other reviews. Also, if you get real close to the monitor and look at it from an angle you can see the infamous cross-hatch pattern in light areas. However, under normal usage, it doesn't mean much. Considering other people seemed to have even worse problems with this monitor, I think I got lucky... I'll keep it since there's nothing better at this price point.
customer_reviews.author: Carl Capasso

customer_reviews.title: It Works Just Fine
customer_reviews.text: I was nervous about ordering this particular monitor from Amazon due to all the negative reviews regarding the first version of this monitor and its associated problems. The price on Amazon was quite a bit better than the price from Dell's website, so I decided to cross my fingers and roll the dice that I was buying the newer improved version of this monitor from Amazon. As it turns out, what I got from Amazon was actually the first version of the monitor, but it works just fine and doesn't have the problems I read about in the reviews.
customer_reviews.author: Ed

customer_reviews.title: Great monitor!
customer_reviews.text: I bought one from the Amazon Warehouse and it came with some light bleeding on the edges. That's my bad for not buying new. But Dell support replaced the monitor for free since it was still under warranty and the monitor is PERFECT with no bleeding whatsoever. You can tell the difference with the higher rez and the 27 inch screensize makes games look awesome. I've noticed NO lag whatsoever and I play lots of FPS's on ultra settings. This monitor is great for gaming and everything else!
customer_reviews.author: Whitestar19

customer_reviews.title: Very Happy with the Purchase
customer_reviews.text: I have held off for a long time upgrading my aging Princeton 19" CAD monitor as modern LCD/LED displays frequently cause me to experience naseau when playing FPS games due to slow panel refresh and ghosting. I've been watching the tech advance and finally was forced to retire my old Princeton monitor when it ate it's transformers. This Dell was a great buy. So, yeah, there is occasionally, a thin yellow line at the extreme edge of the display. It's not always noticeable. The display is ridiculously clean and crisp when rendering games and I am a very happy boy. Now...just need to upgrade the video card...
customer_reviews.author: Fuzzy & The LAW

customer_reviews.title: Looked at Apple Cinema
customer_reviews.text: I do video and photo editing. After realizing the colors on a book cover I was creating could not be seen accuratly without a Professional Monitor I looked a the Apple Cinema Display. Apple is great but the price is not. I ended up with this monitor because the price was fair and the specs were equal to the Cinema Display. This is really the best Monitor I have ever owned. And Wow it's great! In fact I went ahead and order another as I would have spent the same about for an only 1 Apple Display. I don't use Dell computers but they got this right!
customer_reviews.author: eraid0

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful!
customer_reviews.text: I've been stuck on a Mac Display 24", state of the art back six years ago... but this monitor from Dell is absolutely stunning. No glare issues I can see, not a single bad pixel, the monitor base lets the monitor comfortable adjust in several different directions easily plus up and down height -- it is just perfect. My only complaint is that when I work from the office now, I'll feel like I'm going blind -- this monitor far exceeds what my work deploys. One more reason to work from home.
customer_reviews.author: Greg B. Gallagher

customer_reviews.title: Almost 7 years later and still works flawlesly.
customer_reviews.text: This was a great buy, I just wish I could get full resolution with HDMI cable. Other than that, it's perfect. I use DP port.
customer_reviews.author: Real guy

customer_reviews.title: A great monitor
customer_reviews.text: I wish it had vertical adjustments but I love this monitor. I was looking for something similar to a thunderbolt display without the $1k price tag and this is perfect for that. I threw out a dual-monitor setup for a single one of these and it's been working fine. I use this monitor interchangeably between my desktop via DVI and my Macbook Pro via display port. Switching between inputs is easy with the monitor's menu buttons.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole

customer_reviews.title: I'm very impressed
customer_reviews.text: This monitor is a huge improvement over my Samsung LCD. I use it mainly for photo editing (Photoshop and Lightroom 5) and CAD. It's almost like my vision improved working on this thing. Yes, because of the resolution, text is small and on some programs so are the menus. But it's as simple in most cases as hitting CTL+ and you're good to go. The other nice thing is that you can really zoom in and the text stays extremely sharp. The anti-glare is a non-issue. I don't notice it at all. I would say go for it and you'll be happy.
customer_reviews.author: astrodog

customer_reviews.title: First Impressions
customer_reviews.text: The auto color setting feature allows you to tie a color mode (i.e. sRGB) to a particular application like Photoshop when it opens. There are other formats which can be tied to other applications. The high resolution and color accuracy makes for exciting photo displays. From what I can see, this monitor is equally as good as the Apple high resolution monitors. After I spend more time with this monitor I'm sure I'll have more to say.
customer_reviews.author: H. Polio

customer_reviews.title: Great Monitor Ruined by Backlight Bleed
customer_reviews.text: I really liked this screen, the feature set and image quality were top notch, and the gaming and multimedia at 1440p was incredible, but every one that I had [ 3 exchanges from Amazon and one from Dell] suffered from terrible backlight bleed in the lower left hand corner, much like many other reviewers have mentioned. I thought the odds of getting a good one were pretty high, but after 4 exchanges I decided to move on and try something else.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Good Stuff
customer_reviews.text: This monitor can be overclocked like a beast. 60 Hz? Try 85 Hz (via DisplayPort), no problem (google for how to do this with Nvidia or AMD cards). Great for games (you'll need a lot of graphics horsepower to drive 1440 @ 85 fps. Color accuracy is very good. I've calibrated mine with a Spyder3Pro without any issues. Buttons feel solid, stand feels solid. No dead pixels. Not much else to say. Every manufacturer is going to have a couple of duds that slip through QA, but mine wasn't one of them.
customer_reviews.author: Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Solid monitor
customer_reviews.text: Although it looks like it was sealed by Dell, some cables were not in their own plastic bags. They looked like they were thrown in the box and show some wear and tear. Monitor looks good no scratches, no dead pixels or noticeable back-light bleeding. Good color production and brightness. I don't like the stand as it's too wobbly (slightest movement cause this) I'm not sure if I got a refurbished one instead of new, but my concerns are not serious enough to send it back.
customer_reviews.author: Alan K

customer_reviews.title: Very much worth the money
customer_reviews.text: I got another brand before this to save some money and it was back in the box within 5 minutes. These are expensive but if you scale an image of a persons face up to life size, it's almost as awkward as having someone in your space its so flippin clear. The screen is weighted and, goes up and down vertically with not too much effort (one hand), tips forward and side to side and, IT'S ACTUALLY 27". The one I bought first said 27" and 2" of that were black borders!!!! I have 3 of these now for my CADD guys.
customer_reviews.author: Smartguy

customer_reviews.title: Probably the best value out there at this time June-2013
customer_reviews.text: I've been waiting for the much higher resolution monitors to come down in price. I bought the Dell 30 U3011 a few years ago so I've got experience with these. When this monitor came down to $550 for a full featured (all connection ports including DisplayPort, as well as tilt and vertical stand) I knew I had to have it. The quality is awesome - not a single blown pixel. Quality product. If you're not used to a monitor that can do 2560x1440, then do yourself a favor and splurge on this one!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Kingofbytes

customer_reviews.title: Great monitor......
customer_reviews.text: This is a great monitor for photo editing and just an all around good picture... I already owned a spider color 4 calibrator and it didn't take much.. I did bump up the brightness a little however. I bought two of these for a super high end system i just built... If you wait for the right deal, you can make out like I did and pick Em up for only $650 shipped... I dont known if those prices will come back or not, but if so I would snag up another one to complete my tri monitor setup with these...
customer_reviews.author: Jerome Howard

customer_reviews.title: Amazing no issues
customer_reviews.text: After returning an ASUS monitor due to bad backlight bleeding issues, I went with this Dell due to high customer reviews. While some customers complained of backlight bleed issues on this monitor, the majority of people seemed like they got good monitors so I took my chances. I am very happy that I got a flawless monitor, no dead pixels, no backlight bleed. It is roulette any time you buy a monitor, but Dell seems to have worked out their issues, and I recommend buying this monitor to anyone. Bought January 3rd, 2014.
customer_reviews.author: C. Sawyer

customer_reviews.title: No dead pixels, excellent color out of the box.
customer_reviews.text: I received the item very quickly (A little over a week) for being at an APO, and it arrived in "comfy" packaging. Out of the box, I plugged the included Dual Link DVI into the monitor and pc, plugged in the power, and away I went. I had no issues out of the box. Of certain note though, if you are using this for gaming I highly suggest changing the preset to Gaming and disabling the Dynamic Contrast setting. Trust me on that. NO DEAD PIXELS! Overall, excellent seller and superb quality.
customer_reviews.author: SomePerson64

customer_reviews.title: High resolution - looks amazing
customer_reviews.text: I read a bunch of reviews regarding the other Dell 27" monitor, the U2711, where people absolutely hated the overbearing anti-glare coating, and I had also seen reviews about this screen being much better about the coating - I think this monitor has just the right amount of AGC - it's there and keeps the glare down but it's not harsh at all. I wouldn't change it at all. The only downside to this monitor is that now all my pictures I thought looked fantastic now only look reasonably good - this monitor exposes all the flaws that lower-res monitors just can't.
customer_reviews.author: Scott G.

customer_reviews.title: Just as good if not better than the current apple 27" Thunderbolt Monitor, at half the price. WIN WIN!
customer_reviews.text: I am so used to the high quality of apple monitors for all these years that I was very reluctant to consider anything else. But then I purchased a pair of these and was blown away by how awesome they are, for half the price. So for the price of one apple monitor I now have 2 of these and wonder why I waited so long!!
customer_reviews.author: TommyBoyChicago

customer_reviews.title: Issue with entering PowerSave mode.
customer_reviews.text: It worked well for a year then stopped. Now it always enter PowerSave Mode as soon as I connect it. Issue well known by Dell. I have reset it to factory settings many times (through a Dell rep's post on a forum, by pressing down the power button for 10 secs while unpowered), no improvement. Some issue with the hardware/ firmware reset. I am connecting it to my macbookpro through a mini DisplayPort cable to Diplay port cable. You might want to check out more recent monitors, as Dell may (or may not) have fixed this issue.
customer_reviews.author: Anne-Marie

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful for coding
customer_reviews.text: I use this monitor for computer programming -- reading small text -- so I'm sensitive to any jitter, blurring, or dead pixels. I've tried a couple of others, but this is the best for my purpose. A close second was a Samsung, but this Dell was close in price at the time I was ready to buy. The only downside is that driving such a huge number of pixels required some tinkering of my computer, particularly getting a displayport cable to connect my Dell m4600 laptop. The CPU just won't drive enough data through HDMI.
customer_reviews.author: eric j larson

customer_reviews.title: This is what high-end consumer / low-end professional monitors should be like...
customer_reviews.text: This is what high-end consumer / low-end professional monitors should be like... great out of the box experience, unbeatably straight-forward on-monitor controls with the outstanding Dell team behind them. The first one we received had experienced something unfortunate in shipping and we had the replacement in two days, cross-shipped. 5 stars for Amazon, 5 stars for Dell.
customer_reviews.author: J. Bullock

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Dell Ultrasharp 27"
customer_reviews.text: Monitor rotates, moves up and down, and compared to a 24 inch LCD is huge improvement in size (did not expect). Having a display port connection and a resolution of 2560 x 1440 makes this monitor a great deal. I have been using Dell Ultrasharps for 10+ years and have never had one fail (have 6 total across PC's around the house), I have simply upgraded screen inch size over the years. Highly recommend them as they are really clear and height adjustment really helps keep one's neck/back from hurting from tiling head down to see vs. non-adjustable.
customer_reviews.author: Loren Whisler

customer_reviews.title: Best monitor I've owned
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my Mac Mini, as a cheaper alternative to the Apple Cinema display. I needed to order a different cable to get the maximum resolution. Once I did, I suddenly had a beautiful, large image. It is a pleasure to work on this monitor. It makes me more productive in design work. The display is also attractive with a minimal base and height adjustment is fairly smooth. The screen is large but does not dominate my desk. This was an excellent value. Nice job, Dell.
customer_reviews.author: Train to Skaville

customer_reviews.title: Extreme clarity
customer_reviews.text: This is a fantastic monitor! I have it connected to two different laptops via a kvm switch. Maximum VGA resolution is fine, but this monitor really shows its stuff when you connect it via the Displayport adapter. I can run 3 full screen apps with no overlap and no loss in clarity. The Dell screen management utility gives a flexible method to manage multiple full screen windows. The matte screen cuts glare the same significantly. Movies in full HD resolution look great in either full screen or in a window.
customer_reviews.author: Jd

customer_reviews.title: buy this instead of the apple display.
customer_reviews.text: been a tech enthusaist for over a decade now, and this is THE best monitor I've ever used. I'm using the apple thunderbolt display 27" with this one side by side, and you can see this monitor's superiority in one glance. did i mention this is a matte display? horay for no annoying reflections. i cannot recommend this monitor enough.
customer_reviews.author: masterfufu

customer_reviews.title: No dead pixels, bright and wonderful display.
customer_reviews.text: Received version A00 Manufacturing date Feb 2014. Unit has no dead pixels, no excess light bleed, and no problems. The display is large, bright, and competent. Oddly it came with a VGA cable (you can't drive this display at full resolution with VGA), but no DisplayPort cable. The included CD seemed like bloatware and we did not install it.
customer_reviews.author: brycen

customer_reviews.title: Very nice monitor for the MacBook pro
customer_reviews.text: I'm using this monitor with my late 2013 15" MacBook Pro and have it connected to a Belkin smart hub. The monitor works perfectly in both clamshell and dual monitor mode. OS X Mavericks recognized the monitor and I was surprised to find a custom color profile. I still recommend a manual adjustment, but it provided a good starting point. Overall I am very happy with this and would recommend it as a good alternative to folks unable to get their hands on a Cinema Display.
customer_reviews.author: usc2k

customer_reviews.title: make sure you get a good one
customer_reviews.text: first one had stuck pixel cluster right in the middle, had to argue with amazon a bit to get an exchange. they at first wanted me to contact dell (see if dell could troubleshoot?? it). finally got a representative that wasnt brain dead, got a replacement 2nd day air. there is a bit of image retention that shows up even on the dimmest settings and it takes awhile for it to disappear.
customer_reviews.author: silverboi

customer_reviews.title: I bought this monitor despite the complaints by other reviewers, and I'm glad I risked it.
customer_reviews.text: I'm about 4 months into my purchase, and the monitor looks great. Not a single dead pixel. It's hard to look at monitors with larger pixel sizes now, I'm spoiled. Color seems spot on, but I've not put a color meter to it. I don't use it in the dark, so I'm not sure if there is a light bleeding problem, but what LCD doesn't have those issues nowadays? It's a problem with the tech, not this monitor.
customer_reviews.author: Nymix

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly with Mac mini 2012
customer_reviews.text: I bought the Dell U2713HM for my Mac mini 2012. I use the "Mini DisplayPort (ThunderboltTM Port Compatible) to DisplayPort Cable" to connect Mac mini with the monitor in order to get the full resolution(2560 x 1440 dpi). The cable is a lot cheaper then Mini MB571Z/A DisplayPort to Dual-Link DVI Adapter. Color wise it works perfectly with my Epson Stylus 1280 printer. Dislike the design of the back of the monitor but since I won't be seeing it I'm fine with it. I mostly use it for art purpose and I thought it's a decent monitor ESP for the price.
customer_reviews.author: C.T

customer_reviews.title: Very clear and good color
customer_reviews.text: I really like this monitor. It has good color and great viewing angles compared to my old Dell. The controls are pretty standard and there are some nice USB pass-through features. It also has just about every kind of display adapter you can think of. My only complaint is that the HDMI port only supports up to 1080p instead of its native 1440p. This won't be an issue if you have DVI or DisplayPort. Overall I think it's a pretty good deal for the price that I purchased it at.
customer_reviews.author: Haronious

customer_reviews.title: Has slightly noticeable visual artifacts
customer_reviews.text: This is a very good monitor and I mostly agree with the other reviews on its strengths. However, it has one important flaw for me. I don't know whether it's just my unit, but I've also read reports elsewhere about this problem: On a bright background (e.g. white), the lower half of the screen displays a faint pattern of thin diagonal alternating bright and dark bands. It's barely noticeable at arm's length, but quite noticeable if you look at the screen from half that distance. My friend who also bought this didn't notice the bands on his monitor until I told him and he looked closely. I think I'm going to return my order.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Chia

customer_reviews.title: Perfect monitor!! Dell got the anti glare just right with this model.
customer_reviews.text: I love this monitor. I prefer matte over glossy and Dell got it just right with this model. It's just the right compromise between glossy and matte to eliminate glare. The colors are crisp and vibrant, text looks great and white is white. (I had previoulsy bought the U2711 and swapped it for this model and it's much better for a home environment.) No dead pixels and no edge bleed on my unit.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Still great after almost 6 years!!!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this monitor new when it came out in 2013. It is still working flawlessly!
customer_reviews.author: meinhard57

customer_reviews.title: Dell U2713  27" LED Lit Monitor
customer_reviews.text: This is a great monitor for the monitor. The color is natural, resolution sharp and clear. It was easy to install and is energy efficient. I especially like the pivoting function, since I work with a lot of difference size documents. It saves a lot of scrolling. I compared a lot of models before I purchased this one. It definitely offers a lot for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Reader

customer_reviews.title: Awesome high end monitor for the price
customer_reviews.text: Since I can't afford the Apple Thunderbolt display, I bought this to connect to my 13" Macbook Pro (Mid 2012) via the mini displayport to displayport cable. The result is stunning, I will never go back to a non WQHD display again. Well worth every $ and I got this at $572 from Amazon approved third party vendor BRAND NEW. Extremely happy with my purchase. Digital pictures look completely different and way better than any big screen 1080p TV ever will. No issues with any dead pixels so far.
customer_reviews.author: KatiRollKing

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: Bought both this and an Asus PB278Q at the same time. Both are excellent monitors. This one was more expensive than the Asus, but has the built-in USB ports, and generally a (slightly) more "professional" appearance about it. I have no hesitation recommending this monitor, and would buy another given a need.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: First try ok, second ended up being perfect
customer_reviews.text: Just bought it and unpacked it. Nothing fancy. It has a couple of dead pixels in the upper right corner and significant light bleed in the lower left corner (obvious on full black background, invisible on anything colored). I guess that's where the price difference comes from. 5/25 EDIT: Ordered a replacement. Amazon was great, as expected, and had the replacement in two days. No dead pixels, no background light bleed anywhere; the image is perfect. No option but 5 stars, I guess.
customer_reviews.author: mddel

customer_reviews.title: Was worried but no problems at all!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered mine Friday 5/31/2013 and than later started reading more reviews and became a bit worried that I might get one with a lot of light bleed. I know Dell backs their products up and will replace if there is a problem. It came Monday 6/3/2013 and only took ten minutes to unpack and setup. It is great, no dead pixels and no light bleed problems. It is everything Amazon says, could not want a better monitor.
customer_reviews.author: Charles

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Monitor!!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these monitors for my home-office, and I have three of them at work -- and they awesome! Great picture quality! awesome resolution! The only draw-back I can think of is that they do not come with a DisplayPort cable, and that's the only connector through which you can get the full screen resolution... so don't forget to order a DisplayPort cable!
customer_reviews.author: T.S.

customer_reviews.title: Great monitor for photography
customer_reviews.text: I'm thrilled with this monitor. I'm a professional photographer and replaced an NEC Multisync with this one. I like it much better! The colors are true even out of the box, and the detail is sharp. I have no trouble with ambient light glare. I find the brightness and color consistent even after hours of editing. I'm thrilled with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Sha7759

customer_reviews.title: Great monitor for the price
customer_reviews.text: Excellent color, good whites, good blacks. Compared with an older Westinghouse monitor the picture quality is really incredible. No dead/stuck pixels, quality construction. My only complaint is that it's a bit hard to get it to be perfectly level, the adjustments seemed a little loose.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!!
customer_reviews.text: Upgraded from a Dell 22" (2209WA) and couldn't be happier. Using this as my primary for programming, web development, and photography editing. Happy with the color accuracy for my photography work as well as the out of the box calibration. Also purchases the Dell speaker that attaches to the bottom of the monitor which has nice sound and looks very clean and attractive.
customer_reviews.author: CM

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful screen
customer_reviews.text: The only reason why I'm giving this 4 stars instead of 5 is that the VG coating still slightly irritates me. The older model if this monitor the 2711 had a VG coating that gave the screen a very matte finish which is what I did not like about it vs an Apple Cinema Display, this was supposedly corrected on this model, which it has but is still quite noticeable.
customer_reviews.author: Hung K. Tram

customer_reviews.title: I am IN LOVE with it
customer_reviews.text: I recently bought a whole new computer setup, and decided if I was going to go for it, I had to go all in, so I decided to splurge for this monitor. Boy did I make a good purchase. The resolution is absolutely amazing, and the anti-gloss screen is just to my liking (it may bother some though, but it's very un-noticable). It creates barely any heat, and the preset modes for different computer usages (gaming, movies, etc.) really work well. The viewing angles are also splendid. If you're looking for a superb monitor with enough work space to do many things at once, I could not recommend this more highly.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Schwartz

customer_reviews.title: DO buy the mini display port to display port cable to use with Mac Mini!
customer_reviews.text: Once I got the correct cable (The startech one mentioned in "frequently bought together" above), this monitor is ideal for use with my Mac Mini. The high resolution and widescreen display make it idea for side-by-side document work. I only wish I had known to buy the mini-dp to dp cable when I bought the monitor.
customer_reviews.author: Jenny H.

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Connected to my ASUS Transformer TX300-CA minidisplay port and was recognized immediately, at the maximum resolution. Good monitor for the price, works OK with AutoCAD, Word, Excel and Outlook, also good for looking at websites. Looks also nice on my desk. I will order two more.
customer_reviews.author: Ricardo Cruz

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic monitor
customer_reviews.text: This is a gorgeous monitor - that's all you really need to know. I own a Macbook Pro Retina and I'm accustomed to Apple Cinema Displays, so I have high standards for what a monitor should look like: this Dell (surprisingly enough) fits the bill. The colors are vibrant and the display looks great. No complaints in terms of structural design - it isn't the slickest hardware in the world, but it is sturdy and durable, which is what really matters. Would buy this monitor again.
customer_reviews.author: Graham Ramsey

customer_reviews.title: All around great monitor
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this monitor. The images look great and there's no dusty look of anti-glare material. Everything just seems so sharp. The only criticism I would make is that it auto-detects signal for all inputs except display port. This cost me a half hour of digging to track down; that accomplished I really like it and would gladly purchase a second.
customer_reviews.author: J & R Rdbk

customer_reviews.title: Crisp accurate color many months of use and no issues ...
customer_reviews.text: Crisp accurate color many months of use and no issues. The only thing I worry about is when my desktop computer is booting up, the bios screen and initial Windows logo is displayed in a strangely unsupported refresh rate or resolution which causes a green static interference which I worry indicates that it's damaging the monitor.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon W.

customer_reviews.title: Great connected to a mac mini with hdmi!
customer_reviews.text: This monitor connected to a mac mini with hdmi cable is fantastic. Writing this on day 1 and will update regularly with experience. Cannot beat the price for the quality. Dell warranty and Amazon return makes this purchase worth trying for anyone wanting a larger monitor and higher resolutions.
customer_reviews.author: BMH

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: This is an amazing monitor. Great color, brightness and viewing angle. Looks great at native resolution, and in lower (1920x1080). Actually had to use it in 1080p for a bit as the displayport->dvi adapter I had wouldn't go above that.
customer_reviews.author: krism

customer_reviews.title: Running with Windows, I use each half of the ...
customer_reviews.text: Running with Windows, I use each half of the screen for different applications - web browsing / email / spreadsheets. To make the windows take up exactly half the screen, click on the window you want to move (give it keyboard focus) and use this keyboard shortcut: Windows Key + Left Arrow or Windows Key + Right Arrow.
customer_reviews.author: anonymous

customer_reviews.title: but it works great and is a good deal when compared to the ...
customer_reviews.text: Instead of purchasing the Apple Display, you should purchase this - it is about $300 cheaper. It is NOT a glossy display, but it works great and is a good deal when compared to the Apple Display, if you don't have to have the glossiness.
customer_reviews.author: Drew

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic monitor!
customer_reviews.text: Was more than pleased with this purchase.Did my research and settled on this one. The out of the box picture quality is amazing. The 2560x1440 resolution is really great. My games are beyond gorgeous with this thing. Amazon also at the time had the lowest price for it. Plus 2 day free shipping! An all round great shopping experience. Whether gaming, working, or just web surfing. this monitor is just a joy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Vaperstylz

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I was a little afraid to purchase after some of the negative review re: light bleed and poor color, but I have been completely satisfied. The color is beautiful, there is no light bleed, the menus are easy to use and adjust for mac. Just make sure if you're using a macbook that you buy the mini dp to dp cable that amazon recommends. I wanted a single monitor rather than a dual monitor set-up and the extra resolution makes a huge difference. I can use adobe graphic design and video products all while having my email and an internet browser open and accessible. Great purchase!
customer_reviews.author: mbro

customer_reviews.title: Works great (no issues as described in 1 start reviews)
customer_reviews.text: I have it over a year now and works fantastic. I read the 1 start reviews and I do not see any issues as described in the reviews. In fact I was planning to buy another real soon.
customer_reviews.author: Maroli Licardie

customer_reviews.title: ... had this for a couple months and I absolutely love it. I got it because I have a ...
customer_reviews.text: I've had this for a couple months and I absolutely love it. I got it because I have a Lenovo Yoga 2 and with the resolution I thought I could get better resolution. Still trying to figure that part out but I do love this monitor.
customer_reviews.author: Connie

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic monitor
customer_reviews.text: The best monitor I've ever used. The colors are beautiful and accurate, the menu system is excellent, it has all the ports I need, and it can get quite bright if you want. The stand is easy to adjust, keeps the monitor in place, and allows lots of different adjustments.
customer_reviews.author: DE

customer_reviews.title: Excellent display, great value.
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic monitor! I love Dell's high end monitors, and this one is the best yet. Very bright, uniform quality display, with excellent angular response so that even viewing from a foot away there is no visible color change from center to edges. Works great with Mac laptops using display port.
customer_reviews.author: P. Kaczkowski

customer_reviews.title: Very nice monitor
customer_reviews.text: It's hard to justify the cost for something like this sometimes, but this monitor truly shines in every aspect. It was purchased for our marketing staff to lay out designs for promotional materials and the extra screen size and resolution is superb. No complaints!
customer_reviews.author: J. Such

customer_reviews.title: Loving IT!
customer_reviews.text: So fat this has been a really nice monitor.... crisp graphics (my wife is a graphic Designer and it was either this or the Apple Thunderbolt, and at this price it was worth a shot) She loves it, and we get many complements on it when people see it in out home... great functionality and price make this one a winner
customer_reviews.author: David Mozier

customer_reviews.title: All around pretty awesome. Good value.
customer_reviews.text: Sold crisp picture. Fights glare very well. Nice adjustable stand. Great for software dev or pretty much anything else for that matter. If you've got a macbook pro or similar, make sure you get a displayport to mini-dp adapter like the Accel B112B to make sure you get full 1440p resolution.
customer_reviews.author: Public Name

customer_reviews.title: awesome !
customer_reviews.text: so far so good. pulled it out of the box and plugged it in. its that easy. actually returned an Apple 27" Cinema display that flickered and wouldnt connect... (thats another story) so i returned that and got this and ive been happy ever since.
customer_reviews.author: Just Bill

customer_reviews.title: Great monitor!
customer_reviews.text: Outstanding monitor. Great clarity and color. I love the size -- lots of real estate for multiple windows. The standard RGB color mode is excellent. You get a lot for the price. You could pay a lot more and not get as good a picture as this.
customer_reviews.author: A. Carter

customer_reviews.title: Died after 2 years
customer_reviews.text: I've purchased 3 of these. They worked great for 2 years. Two died in the past 3 months.
customer_reviews.author: Bill from Mountain View

customer_reviews.title: Great Display
customer_reviews.text: Bought it on sale around Black Friday for $540 and it has been a beautiful monitor. I'm a big Steam gamer and play games from bioshock to total war and I have seen very little lag/ ghosting. Well worth the price I got it at.
customer_reviews.author: Brazensage

customer_reviews.title: I like this large size screen
customer_reviews.text: I like this large size screen, and paired with an Apple Mac Mini and display port cable, I get ultra high resolution. Images look great.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Great price for its quality
customer_reviews.text: I will start with my disclaimer. I am a big fan of dell monitors, and I am not a gamer. I am a coder who spend many hours looking at the screen. Given its price and video quality, I think it is a great 27" monitor to compliment your computer. The 90 degrees rotating feature is great if you like want a vertical view, which I find it very useful for coding or if you have 2 monitors with little desk estate. In addition, I love its connectivity with the USB ports on its side.
customer_reviews.author: ecnerwallly

customer_reviews.title: Excellent,
customer_reviews.text: Early days yet, but so far I have found this to be a great purchase. It's extremely sharp, and it renders colors very nicely. About as true to reality as any display I have seen costing much more. I use it to work on photos and as my all-purpose display. It performs flawlessly in both roles. I'd purchase this again. No hesitation.
customer_reviews.author: Jaydee

customer_reviews.title: everything is a-ok
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with this monitor. Bright colors and the whites are so white. I use dual monitors and my previous monitor's white background looks my teeth after only brushing once a week for a year when side-by-side. Controls are easy and intuitive. No regrets about buying it. The only complaint, and it may not be a problem over the long run, the base and mount might be a little underbuilt. This may be a problem over the years, maybe not, but no regrets purchasing it.
customer_reviews.author: Ars Bender

customer_reviews.title: Jul 2013 Rev A00 -  No problems encountered
customer_reviews.text: I am not sure if this means the quality issues were fixed or if I just got lucky, but I took a chance with this Amazon order of this excellent monitor, and was not disappointed. No bleed issues, no color miscalibrations, no problems whatsoever. I'll leave the technical praise-singing to others more qualified, but this monitor was a huge upgrade over my current 24" Dell 2405FPW. One thing to definitely note, as others have mentioned, you *need* to use a DVI-D (provided in box) to get the full 2560 x 1440 res.
customer_reviews.author: S. Buck

customer_reviews.title: Great quality and flexibility
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a primary monitor in a two monitor system. The image quality is great and supports very high resolutions. I noticed a slight variance in brightness as expressed in other reviews but it is not substantial enough to create any issues for me.
customer_reviews.author: T. Runyan

customer_reviews.title: Looks amazing, arrived fas!
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to replace my broken WFP3011, I didn't want to spend 1.5k on another monitor though, but I really wanted the 2560 resolution. This fit the bill just fine, at a fraction of the price!
customer_reviews.author: A.J.

customer_reviews.title: Dell makes great IPS monitors
customer_reviews.text: As usual, Dell makes great IPS monitors. Awesome colors, awesome viewing angles, great resolution (due to the limitations of the HDMI spec, you can achieve the native resolution via other means, in my case with a DVI cable).
customer_reviews.author: MoonStorm

customer_reviews.title: Happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful monitor. Easy menu system. Shipped with no defective pixels. Good color reproduction. Buy the Dell monitor speaker system.
customer_reviews.author: Brad Humphrey

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Ordered on Nov 15 and got it Nov 16 2013 Build date was Sept 2013 Was worried about many of the issues I was reading about on here but I got a perfect one brand new and sealed in a dell box. No dead pixels, crosshatching, bleeding and uniformity was good. Beautiful screen and stand. Adjustability was the easiest I've used on a monitor and standard settings out of the box is already perfect.
customer_reviews.author: sy

customer_reviews.title: Great quality for editing photos
customer_reviews.text: Works as it should. As described. Great quality for editing photos.
customer_reviews.author: Redman

customer_reviews.title: You Will Not Regret This
customer_reviews.text: First : Excellent build quality Second : Colors are simply amazing (factory calibrated with its own individual cal sheet) Third : Extremely clean and crisp text..images..gaming Fourth : NO light bleeding around the edges...very even back lighting....this is a major plus for me Replaced an Alienware (Dell) monitor 1920x1080 res with this bad boy, extremely happy with my decision. You wont regret this.
customer_reviews.author: Michael A Fuller

customer_reviews.title: Very nice matte monitor
customer_reviews.text: The delivery was fast and efficient and the monitors look great, they have the same resolution as the apple display, but without the reflective screen. For the price, these monitors are very nice. Happy!
customer_reviews.author: KWG

customer_reviews.title: Ecvellent Monitor
customer_reviews.text: Complements my 27 inch iMac as a second monitor. Display nearly matches the iMac screen and I like its matte finish better. The two USB ports that it provides are also handy.
customer_reviews.author: Bob S.

customer_reviews.title: Dell U2713HM-IPS-LED CVN85 27-Inch Monitor
customer_reviews.text: I purchased 2 of these Dell U2713HM-IPS-LED CVN85 27-Inch moniters for a Dual setup. I could not be more pleased. They have great color. And better yet the color on both monitors (to my eyes) are identical to each other.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great panel
customer_reviews.text: I own this for the office and I own an Apple 27" Thunderbolt Display at home. They're both excellent. The matte finish is a blessing where harsh lighting hits the monitor. Worth every penny to have a gorgeous, vivid display at work where I'm staring at a screen all day.
customer_reviews.author: Andre Chi

customer_reviews.title: Great monitor
customer_reviews.text: I use this for work, personal, and gaming. Good resolution, good graphics, and fluid motion for games/movies. It is a little pricy. I picked mine up refurbished off of Amazon which helped with the price a bit.
customer_reviews.author: wowwayman1

customer_reviews.title: Loving it
customer_reviews.text: Love this monitor. One thing to point out is I do have Rev 3 of this monitor. The previous Revs had serious quality issues. I have two of them running on my desktop using Display-port cables. So far so good.
customer_reviews.author: Frenchy

customer_reviews.title: Ah love this monitor!
customer_reviews.text: Code looks amazing, games look amazing, type looks amazing, I couldn't love this monitor more. On macbook pro mid 2010 I get 2560 x 1440 with Accell B143B-007J UltraAV Mini DisplayPort to DisplayPort. There is some minor screen burn image retention but it's still the nicest screen I have ever owned.
customer_reviews.author: HARIBHAKTI V JAGARNAUTH

product_meta.title: Dell U2713HM 27-Inch Screen LED-lit Monitor (Discontinued by Manufacturer)
product_meta.description:
Cinema-like clarity shines on the expansive 27" DellTM UltraSharp U2713HM monitor. Comfort settings and connectivity options help keep you productive. This monitor includes a 3 year advanced exchange warranty.


AMAZON.COM


DELL ULTRASHARP U2713HM 27" MONITOR WITH LED: SEE EVERY DETAIL IN BRILLIANT COLOR.
Cinema-like clarity shines on the expansive 27" Dell UltraSharp U2713HM monitor. Comfort settings and connectivity options help keep you productive.

 * WQHD resolution and accurate colors out of the box: Superb clarity with 2560 x 1440 resolution and over 3.6 million pixels. Features a color gamut of more than 99-percent sRGB.
 *  Excellent comfort and usability: Full adjustability including swivel, tilt, height adjustability and pivot which lets you easily switch to portrait mode.
 *  Eco-friendly design: Compliant with the latest environmental standards and made using environmentally conscious materials.



ULTIMATE VIEWING LIVES ON A GRAND STAGE.


 *  2560x1440 WQHD resolution: Over 3.6 million pixels provide amazing clarity on a spacious 27" LED-backlit display. Easily adjust screen brightness to suit your environment. 
 *  Accurate color right out of the box: Carefully color calibrated at the factory, the U2713HM monitor features more than 99-percent sRGB color space for impressive color from the moment you set it up. 
 *  Wide-angle viewing: Uncompromised color consistency across an ultra-wide viewing angle of 178°/178° gives you broad viewing flexibility and lets you collaborate easily.



MAXIMIZE COMFORT AND CONVENIENCE.


 *  Full adjustability: Work comfortably and view images from a variety of positions with swivel and tilt. Easily switch to portrait mode with pivot. Set your U2713HM to the optimum height with a height-adjustability range of 115mm. 
 * Latest connectivity options: Seamlessly connect your monitor to your desktop, laptop and peripherals such as digital cameras and Blu-ray or DVD players. Digital and analog connections include four USB 3.0 ports, DisplayPort 1.2, DVI (HDCP) and HDMI. 
 * Stay productive with Dell Display Manager: This one-stop software tool lets you quickly access applications such as Auto Mode, Easy Arrange and PowerNap. Use Auto Mode to adjust or auto-assign preset modes to specific applications. Use Easy Arrange to neatly tile your applications, arranging them in your preferred layout. 



AN ENVIRONMENTALLY CONSCIOUS DESIGN.


 * Meets latest environmental standards: The U2713HM monitor meets EPEAT Gold and TCO Certified Displays standards, is ENERGY STAR qualified and CECP compliant.
 * Made with responsible materials: This monitor is made with arsenic-free glass, a mercury-free panel, uses 25-percent post-consumer recycled plastics in its chassis and BFR/PVC-free laminates in its circuit boards. The U2713HM also ships with environmentally responsible packaging.
 * Helps save resources: Enable PowerNap mode to reduce power consumption by dimming the monitor to minimum brightness or by putting it into sleep mode.



GET PEACE OF MIND AND EASE OF OWNERSHIP.
Rest easy long after your purchase with a suite of service and support options. Also, work productively as your U2713HM monitor is compatible with most Dell laptops and workstations.

Compatibility comes easily:
The U2713HM is qualified and tested for compatibility with Dell Precision workstations, Latitude laptops and OptiPlex systems, and offers optimum compatibility.

PHOTO GALLERY
feature_bullets: Rest easy with a 3-year Limited Hardware Warranty and 3 years of Dell’s Advanced Exchange Service.
WQHD resolution and accurate colors out of the box: Superb clarity with 2560 x 1440 resolution and over 3.6 million pixels. Features a color gamut of more than 99-percent sRGB.
Excellent comfort and usability: Full adjustability including swivel, tilt, height adjustability and pivot which lets you easily switch to portrait mode.
Compliant with the latest environmental standards.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.2 out of 5 stars497 ratings4.2 out of 5 stars
